attributes.action: Properly fund the dental industry and make them take on NHS patients.
attributes.additional_details:
Every working person pays national insurance contributions that fund the NHS, yet when a person requires dental treatment through the NHS it is inaccessible.

The NHS dentistry is important to everyone that does not have the means to pay for private treatment. 
Why is it that only people that have the means to pay for private treatment are able to have healthy teeth?
attributes.background:
Ensure that dentists are taking on NHS patients. The dentists will only take on private patients as they are not paid enough to undertake NHS work. 
The dental industry must be changed.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about whether to take on NHS clients are a matter for individual dentists, not the UK Government or Parliament.

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Increase NHS dental care funding to improve availability for child and adults: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/601744

Increase funding to ensure all adults in England have access to an NHS dentist: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/605814
